com.skyhookwireless.accelerator
Class AcceleratorClient

java.lang.Object
  com.skyhookwireless.accelerator.AcceleratorClient

public class AcceleratorClient
extends java.lang.Object

The client object that encapsulates communication with the accelerator service.

Alerts are delivered to the application via the provided PendingIntent. You can call getCampaignVenueTransition(Intent) to get the transition type of this alert intent and call getTriggeringCampaignVenue(Intent) to get the campaign venue that triggered this intent.

If an error occurs, then an intent is generated by the provided pending intent. In this case, hasError(Intent) returns true and getErrorCode(Intent) returns the error code from AcceleratorStatusCodes.

To receive these alerts, IntentService should be declared in the application and wrapped into the PendingIntent passed to AcceleratorClient.

Sample Code: 

    public class AcceleratorTestIntentService
        extends IntentService
    {
        public AcceleratorTestIntentService()
        {
            super("AcceleratorTestIntentService");
        }

        protected void onHandleIntent(Intent intent)
        {
             if (AcceleratorClient.hasError(intent))
             {
                 int errorCode = AcceleratorClient.getErrorCode(intent);

                 // ...
             }
             else
             {
                 CampaignVenue venue =
                     AcceleratorClient.getTriggeringCampaignVenue(intent);
                 if (venue != null)
                 {
                     int transition =
                         AcceleratorClient.getCampaignVenueTransition(intent);

                     // ...
                 }
             }
        }
    }

    // ...

    public PendingIntent getPendingIntent()
    {
        Intent intent = new Intent(this, AcceleratorTestIntentService.class);

        return PendingIntent.getService(
            this,
            0,
            intent,
            PendingIntent.FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT);
    }
IntentService declared in that way should also be added to the manifest of the application along with the Skyhook AcceleratorService.

If a campaign venue enter or exit alert occurs while your app is not running, the service will receive the alert anyway, and can process it: store to the database, send to your server, display a notification to the user, or something else. But it should not start an activity or fragment because components should only become visible in response to a user action.

connectionCallbacks - the callbacks invoked when the client is connected.
connectionFailedListener - the listener which will be notified if the connection attempt fails.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if key is different from the one used in any other AcceleratorClient instance.

Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
Connects to the service.

Returns asynchronously via:

  • AcceleratorClient.ConnectionCallbacks.onConnected()
  • AcceleratorClient.OnConnectionFailedListener.onConnectionFailed(int)

The callbacks will be made on the main thread of the calling Activity.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnects from service.

Returns asynchronously via AcceleratorClient.ConnectionCallbacks.onDisconnected().

The callbacks will be made on the main thread of the calling Activity.

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Determines whether or not client is connected to the service.

Returns:
true if service is running and client is connected to it.

isConnecting

public boolean isConnecting()
Determines whether client is currently connecting to the service.

Returns:
true if connection is in progress.

registerForCampaignMonitoring

public void registerForCampaignMonitoring(PendingIntent pendingIntent,
                                          AcceleratorClient.OnRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResultListener listener)
Register the pending intent used to receive alerts from the accelerator service, and resume campaign monitoring if it was previously running.

Note that this method must be called before calling any of the other campaign monitoring methods.

When complete the AcceleratorClient.OnRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResultListener.onRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResult(int, PendingIntent) callback will be invoked on the calling thread if it already is a prepared looper thread, otherwise it will be invoked on the main thread of the calling Activity.

This method can be called from BroadcastReceiver#onReceive in which case it should be called without calling connect first. For example, to resume campaign monitoring after a device reboot, listen for the BOOT_COMPLETED broadcast and then call this method when it is received.

The pending intent can never be changed after it is set from any AcceleratorClient instance.

If the pending intent is canceled, then campaign monitoring will stop, but the set of monitored campaigns will still be saved. If this method is then called with an equal pending intent, then campaign monitoring will be resumed.

Parameters:
pendingIntent - pending intent to receive alerts from the accelerator service.
listener - the callback that receives the status code for this operation.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if pendingIntent is changed to a different value after it has been set once in any AcceleratorClient instance or if this method is called while a previous call is still in progress.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if pendingIntent or listener is null.

startMonitoringForAllCampaigns

public void startMonitoringForAllCampaigns(AcceleratorClient.OnStartCampaignMonitoringResultListener listener)
Starts monitoring for all campaigns that are active in the portal.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

This affects all accelerator objects in your application.

onStartCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) is called when campaign monitoring is successfully started or failed to be started. Refer to onStartCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) for possible errors when starting campaign monitoring. This callback is invoked on the calling thread if it already is a prepared looper thread, otherwise it will be invoked on the main thread of the calling Activity.

If a campaign venue enter or exit alert occurs while your app is not running, its IntentService would still be running or started to process the intent invoked by Accelerator.

Campaign venue alerts are delivered to the PendingIntent provided by your application. Information about the campaign venue that triggered the alert can be retrieved by calling getCampaignVenueTransition and getTriggeringCampaignVenue.

If an error occurs later, after the campaign monitoring has started successfully, then an alert will be delivered to the provided pending intent. Information about the error can be retrieved by calling hasError and getErrorCode. Note that if the error code is ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED, then all campaign monitoring will be stopped.

If all campaigns are already being monitored, then this method has no effect.

This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.

Parameters:
listener - the callback that receives the status code for this operation.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

stopMonitoringForAllCampaigns

public void stopMonitoringForAllCampaigns(AcceleratorClient.OnStopCampaignMonitoringResultListener listener)
Stops monitoring for all campaigns for all accelerator objects in your application.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

onStopCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) is called when campaign monitoring is successfully stopped or failed to be stopped. Refer to onStopCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) for possible errors when stopping campaign monitoring. This callback is invoked on the calling thread if it already is a prepared looper thread, otherwise it will be invoked on the main thread of the calling Activity.

If no campaigns are currently being monitored, then this method has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the callback that receives the status code for this operation.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

startMonitoringForCampaign

public void startMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String campaignName,
                                       AcceleratorClient.OnStartCampaignMonitoringResultListener listener)
Starts monitoring the specified campaign.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

This method is needed only in cases where fine control of the active campaigns is necessary, and in that case you must call it separately for each campaign you want to monitor. In most cases startMonitoringForAllCampaigns(com.skyhookwireless.accelerator.AcceleratorClient.OnStartCampaignMonitoringResultListener) should be used instead to enable monitoring for all campaigns that are active in the portal. The campaigns you add using this method are shared by all AcceleratorClient objects in your application and can be accessed via getMonitoredCampaigns() method. Note that a call to stopMonitoringForAllCampaigns(com.skyhookwireless.accelerator.AcceleratorClient.OnStopCampaignMonitoringResultListener) from any AcceleratorClient object in your application will stop the monitoring for all campaigns including those started by a call to this method.

onStartCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) is called when monitoring is successfully started for the campaign or failed to be started. Refer to onStartCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) for possible errors when starting campaign monitoring. This callback is invoked on the calling thread if it already is a prepared looper thread, otherwise it will be invoked on the main thread of the calling Activity.

Intents are delivered to the application the same way as for startMonitoringForAllCampaigns(com.skyhookwireless.accelerator.AcceleratorClient.OnStartCampaignMonitoringResultListener).

If the specified campaign is currently being monitored, or if all campaigns are currently being monitored, then this method has no effect. If a campaign is specified which is not active on the portal, then it will be silently ignored.

This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.

Parameters:
listener - the callback that receives the status code for this operation.
campaignName - the name of the campaign to start monitoring.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if campaignName is null or empty.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

stopMonitoringForCampaign

public void stopMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String campaignName,
                                      AcceleratorClient.OnStopCampaignMonitoringResultListener listener)
Stops monitoring the specified campaign.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

This affects all AcceleratorClient objects in your application.

onStopCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) is called when monitoring is successfully stopped for the campaign or failed to be stopped. Refer to onStopCampaignMonitoringResult(int, String) for possible errors when stopping campaign monitoring. This callback is invoked on the calling thread if it already is a prepared looper thread, otherwise it will be invoked on the main thread of the calling Activity.

If the specified campaign is not currently being monitored, then this method has no effect. Note that if all campaigns are being monitored, then calling this method has no effect. It will not stop the specified campaign from being monitored.

Parameters:
listener - the callback that receives the status code for this operation.
campaignName - the name of the campaign to stop monitoring.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if campaignName is null or empty.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

isMonitoringAllCampaigns

public boolean isMonitoringAllCampaigns()
Determines whether all campaigns are currently being monitored or not.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have completed registering a pending intent for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring and waiting for OnRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResultListener#onRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResult to be called.

Returns:
true if all campaigns are currently being monitored.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't completed.

getMonitoredCampaigns

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getMonitoredCampaigns()
Retrieve the set of campaigns currently being monitored from calls to startMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String, com.skyhookwireless.accelerator.AcceleratorClient.OnStartCampaignMonitoringResultListener).

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have completed registering a pending intent for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring and waiting for OnRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResultListener#onRegisterForCampaignMonitoringResult to be called.

This will return an empty set if no campaigns are being monitored. It will also return an empty set if isMonitoringAllCampaigns() is true.

Returns:
set of monitored campaigns.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't completed.

refreshPersona

public void refreshPersona(AcceleratorClient.OnPersonaResultListener listener)
Refresh the demographic persona.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.OnPersonaResultListener will be made on the calling thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread, such as the main thread of the calling Activity. The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See refreshPersona(OnPersonaResultListener, Looper).

If this method is called while a persona refresh operation is already in progress, then that existing operation will be aborted and its callback will be invoked with an ERROR_OPERATION_ABORTED.

Parameters:
listener - The listener for the location result.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if the calling thread is not associated with a looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

refreshPersona

public void refreshPersona(AcceleratorClient.OnPersonaResultListener listener,
                           Looper looper)
Refresh the demographic persona with a callback on the specified Looper thread when complete.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.OnPersonaResultListener will be made on the specified thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread. For cases where the callback can happen on the calling thread, the variant of this method without a Looper can be used. See refreshPersona(OnPersonaResultListener).

Parameters:
listener - The listener for the location result.
looper - The Looper object whose message queue will be used to implement the callback mechanism, or null to make callbacks on the calling thread.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if unable to retrieve looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See requestIPLocation(IPLocationListener, Looper).

Parameters:

setUsageCollectionEnabled

public void setUsageCollectionEnabled(boolean usageCollectionEnabled)
Set whether or not accelerator collects usage information to continually improve the quality of the returned demographic personas. The SDK does not track individual users and completely anonymizes all collected information.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Note that you might receive degraded demographic personas if usage collection is disabled.

The default is that usage collection is enabled.

Parameters:
usageCollectionEnabled - true to enable usage collection and false to disable it.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established.

isUsageCollectionEnabled

public boolean isUsageCollectionEnabled()
Determines whether or not accelerator collects usage information.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

See setUsageCollectionEnabled(boolean)

Returns:
true if accelerator collects usage information.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established.

getVersion

public java.lang.String getVersion()
Returns the Accelerator SDK version.

Returns:
a string containing the version information as ...

getPersona

public Persona getPersona()
Retrieves the demographic persona.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Returns:
demographic persona or null if the persona hasn't been determined yet.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established.

getCurrentVenues

public java.util.Set<CampaignVenue> getCurrentVenues()
Retrieve the set of venues that the user is currently inside for campaigns that are being monitored.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

Note that if campaign monitoring is currently stopped, then this will always return an empty set.

Returns:
set of venues.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established or if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called.

fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues

public void fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues(int limit,
                                       AcceleratorClient.NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener listener)
Fetch the list of venues nearby the current location for campaigns that are being monitored.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

Note that if campaign monitoring is currently stopped, then this will always pass back an empty list.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener will be made on the calling thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread, such as the main thread of the calling Activity. The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues(int, NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener, Looper).

Parameters:
limit - maximum number of entries fetched. The maximum value allowed for this is 100.
listener - The listener for the nearby venues result.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called, or if the calling thread is not associated with a looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues

public void fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues(int limit,
                                       AcceleratorClient.NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener listener,
                                       Looper looper)
Fetch the list of venues nearby the current location for campaigns that are being monitored with a callback on the specified Looper thread when complete.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called. Also the client must have a pending intent registered for campaign monitoring by calling registerForCampaignMonitoring.

Note that if campaign monitoring is currently stopped, then this will always pass back an empty list.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener will be made on the specified thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread. For cases where the callback can happen on the calling thread, the variant of this method without a Looper can be used. See fetchNearbyMonitoredVenues(int, NearbyMonitoredVenuesListener).

Parameters:
limit - maximum number of entries fetched. The maximum value allowed for this is 100.
listener - The listener for the nearby venues result.
looper - The Looper object whose message queue will be used to implement the callback mechanism, or null to make callbacks on the calling thread.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, if registerForCampaignMonitoring hasn't been called, or if unable to retrieve looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

fetchVenueInfo

public void fetchVenueInfo(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> ids,
                           AcceleratorClient.VenueInfoListener listener)
Fetch information for a list of venues.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for VenueInfoListener will be made on the calling thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread, such as the main thread of the calling Activity. The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See fetchVenueInfo(List, VenueInfoListener, Looper).

Parameters:
ids - list of venue ids. At most only the first 100 entries will be used.
listener - the listener for the venue info result. The venues passed to it are in no particular order.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if the calling thread is not associated with a looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

fetchVenueInfo

public void fetchVenueInfo(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> ids,
                           AcceleratorClient.VenueInfoListener listener,
                           Looper looper)
Fetch information for a list of venues with a callback on the specified Looper thread when complete.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for VenueInfoListener will be made on the specified thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread. For cases where the callback can happen on the calling thread, the variant of this method without a Looper can be used. See fetchVenueInfo(List, VenueInfoListener).

Parameters:
ids - list of venue ids. At most only the first 100 entries will be used.
listener - the listener for the venue info result. The venues passed to it are in no particular order.
looper - The Looper object whose message queue will be used to implement the callback mechanism, or null to make callbacks on the calling thread.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if unable to retrieve looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

fetchVenueInfoAtLocation

public void fetchVenueInfoAtLocation(AcceleratorClient.VenueInfoListener listener)
Fetch information for the venues at the current location.

This method will pass back the information for the venues at the current location even if those venues are not currently being monitored in any campaign. At most 10 venues will be passed back.

If there is no recent location then a location will be calculated first before fetching the venue information.

If this method is called while a previous call is already in progress, then that existing operation will be aborted and its callback will be invoked with an ERROR_OPERATION_ABORTED.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for VenueInfoListener will be made on the calling thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread, such as the main thread of the calling Activity. The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See fetchVenueInfoAtLocation(VenueInfoListener, Looper).

Parameters:
listener - the listener for the venue info result. The venues passed to it are ordered approximately from closest to farthest.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if the calling thread is not associated with a looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

fetchVenueInfoAtLocation

public void fetchVenueInfoAtLocation(AcceleratorClient.VenueInfoListener listener,
                                     Looper looper)
Fetch information for the venues at the current location with a callback on the specified Looper thread when complete.

This method will pass back the information for the venues at the current location even if those venues are not currently being monitored in any campaign. At most 10 venues will be passed back.

If there is no recent location then a location will be calculated first before fetching the venue information.

If this method is called while a previous call is already in progress, then that existing operation will be aborted and its callback will be invoked with an ERROR_OPERATION_ABORTED.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for VenueInfoListener will be made on the specified thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread. For cases where the callback can happen on the calling thread, the variant of this method without a Looper can be used. See fetchVenueInfoAtLocation(VenueInfoListener).

Parameters:
listener - the listener for the venue info result. The venues passed to it are ordered approximately from closest to farthest.
looper - The Looper object whose message queue will be used to implement the callback mechanism, or null to make callbacks on the calling thread.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the app does not have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if unable to retrieve looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

fetchRecentCampaignVisits

public void fetchRecentCampaignVisits(int limit,
                                      AcceleratorClient.CampaignVisitsListener listener)
Fetch the list of recent campaign visits.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.CampaignVisitsListener will be made on the calling thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread, such as the main thread of the calling Activity. The variant of this method with a Looper is recommended for cases where the callback needs to happen on a specific thread. See #fetchRecentCampaignVisits(int, CampaignVisitsListener, android.os.Looper).

Parameters:
limit - maximum number of entries fetched. The maximum value allowed for this is 100.
listener - the listener for the recent campaign visits result. The visits passed to it are ordered from most recent to least recent enter time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if the calling thread is not associated with a looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

fetchRecentCampaignVisits

public void fetchRecentCampaignVisits(int limit,
                                      AcceleratorClient.CampaignVisitsListener listener,
                                      Looper looper)
Fetch the list of recent campaign visits with a callback on the specified Looper thread when complete.

Client must be connected to the service by calling connect() and waiting for ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected to be called.

Callbacks for AcceleratorClient.CampaignVisitsListener will be made on the specified thread, which must already be a prepared looper thread. For cases where the callback can happen on the calling thread, the variant of this method without a Looper can be used. See fetchRecentCampaignVisits(int, CampaignVisitsListener).

Parameters:
limit - maximum number of entries fetched. The maximum value allowed for this is 100.
listener - the listener for the recent campaign visits result. The visits passed to it are ordered from most recent to least recent enter time.
looper - The Looper object whose message queue will be used to implement the callback mechanism, or null to make callbacks on the calling thread.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection to Accelerator Services hasn't been established, or if unable to retrieve looper.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
Since:
1.1

hasError

public static boolean hasError(Intent intent)
Whether an error triggered this intent.

Parameters:
intent - the intent generated for alert.
Returns:
true if an error triggered this intent otherwise false.

getErrorCode

public static int getErrorCode(Intent intent)
Returns the error code that explains the error that triggered this intent.

Parameters:
intent - the intent generated for alert.
Returns:
the error code specified in AcceleratorStatusCodes or -1 if hasError(Intent) returns false.

getCampaignVenueTransition

public static int getCampaignVenueTransition(Intent intent)
Returns the transition type of campaign venue transition alert.

Parameters:
intent - the intent generated for campaign venue alert.
Returns:
-1 if the intent is not generated for campaign venue alert. Otherwise returns the CAMPAIGN_VENUE_TRANSITION_ flags value defined in CampaignVenue.

getTriggeringCampaignVenue

public static CampaignVenue getTriggeringCampaignVenue(Intent intent)
Returns the campaign venue that triggers this transition alert.

Parameters:
intent - the intent generated for campaign venue alert.
Returns:
the campaign venue that triggers this transition alert or null if the given intent is not generated for campaign venue transition alert.
